text.__SUMMARY__: Schwartz's worm snake (Typhlops schwartzi) is a species of snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to the Dominican Republic.
text.Etymology: The specific name, schwartzi, is in honor of American herpetologist Albert Schwartz.
text.Further reading: Thomas R. 1989. "The relationships of Antillean Typhlops (Serpentes: Typhlopidae) and the description of three new Hispaniolan species. pp. 409–432. In: Woods CA (editor). 1989. Biogeography of the West Indies: Past, Present, and Future. Gainesville, Florida: Sandhill Crane Press. xvii + 878 pp. (Typhlops schwartzi, new species, p. 409).
